avalancheActivity.comment: The more recent wind slabs can be released in particular on steep shady slopes above the tree line, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Avalanches can in very isolated cases penetrate near-ground layers of the snowpack and reach medium size. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise in the late morning to moistening of the snowpack in some cases. Isolated small moist avalanches are possible as the moisture increases. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The mostly small wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The fresh wind slabs are lying on unfavourable layers in particular on steep shady slopes at elevated altitudes.
Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack.
Only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year. Snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

tendency.highlights: 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 1200 m. The avalanche danger will increase but remain within the current danger level.

avalancheActivity.comment: The old wind slabs are small and can only be released in isolated cases. Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found on extremely steep shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year. The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations.
Shady slopes: The snowpack consists of faceted crystals.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack on steep slopes. Only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

tendency.highlights: Wind and new snow. Up to 20 cm of snow will fall above approximately 1100 m.
